businessProfile.name: Trattoria Ciao
businessProfile.address: 823 SE 47th Terrace, Cape Coral, FL 33904, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 823 SE 47th Terrace, Cape Coral, FL 33904, USA

reviews.text: I'm a very picky person. I have nothing but, praise for this family restaurant. First time and not the last time. The food was wonderful and service was very good. Could not be more please with the place.

Second time here and had a fantastic dinner. Service was great and the atmosphere kind reminded me of an enoteca in Italy. The Bolognese Rigatoni was phenomenal as was the focaccia and meatball appetizer. The House Chianti was a generous pour and from a good winery. The only qualm we had with the meal was the short rib lasagna which was lacking about in quantity of the noodles and they were overdone. If there were a few more and they were al dente it would have been amazing as the flavor was great. Will be back again though.

We went on a Friday night, last minute. This was our first time going so didn't know what to expect. The first thing I noticed was the live entertainment. Nice music, not being played too loud. Small atmosphere but very nice a quaint. My boyfriend ordered the short rib rigatoni and it was really really good. Definitely will order again. I had the wood fired pizza, it was by far one of the best places I have ever been to eat. Will definitely go again.

Parking lot is next door in someone else's space, so be careful about getting ticketed. The place is nice inside, very small and intimate, with a family restaurant feel. Service can be spotty, depending on who you get. The house wine wasn't great, a little harsh. Amongst all the apps and entrees we ordered, the single best dish was the Caesar salad. Fresh and crunchy with not too much dressing and pleasant citrus notes. Entrees were somewhat disappointing. Just ok, not incredibly flavorful. At one point we could smell very burnt pizza, perhaps when the cook forgot that he had one in the oven. Decent place, and nice to support the family owners, but none of us is desperate to return.

I like pizza and pasta here. Tiramisu also good. I will definitely go again.

You can park cross the street next to Leetrans I mean in the Walgreens.

editorial_summary.overview: Homey old-school neighborhood place serving traditional Italian cuisine & wood-fired pizza.

recentReviews.text: First, I‚Äôm trying it. It was very delicious very relaxing cozy food was phenomenal and the smell from the Woodfire oven took me back to Sicily.
Smaller restaurant (and menu), however the food and service were great.  Hudson was awesome, the fettuccine alfredo was great, the short rib lasagna and bread were tasty as well.

We went on a Friday night, last minute. This was our first time going so didn't know what to expect. The first thing I noticed was the live entertainment. Nice music, not being played too loud. Small atmosphere but very nice a quaint. My boyfriend ordered the short rib rigatoni and it was really really good. Definitely will order again. I had the wood fired pizza, it was by far one of the best places I have ever been to eat. Will definitely go again.

We had a party of 8, the food, service, live music, and atmosphere were wonderful! Our server was very attentive. We had salads, pizzas, meatballs, calamari, and husband had the swordfish dinner special which was the best he has ever had.  Adorable place with a very welcoming vibe.  Great wine choices and the tiramisu was a perfect ending to our meal.

This little place was great and served very good pizza. My only complaint is that we were served a pizza and a steak knife to cut it. If we go back I will request them to cut our pizza for us as a steak knife was ready quite hard to use. We wound up barbarically ripping it apart. Which seems off in such a nice establishment. Still 5 stars just cut my pizza!

I like pizza and pasta here. Tiramisu also good. I will definitely go again.

You can park cross the street next to Leetrans I mean in the Walgreens.
Great food great people a must try a gem of Cape Coral best Italian restaurant in Lee county

detailedReviews.author: michelle sackos
detailedReviews.text: Amazing dinner!

detailedReviews.author: Carmelo Lamotta
detailedReviews.text: First, I‚Äôm trying it. It was very delicious very relaxing cozy food was phenomenal and the smell from the Woodfire oven took me back to Sicily.

detailedReviews.author: Jackie Mahan
detailedReviews.text: Smaller restaurant (and menu), however the food and service were great.  Hudson was awesome, the fettuccine alfredo was great, the short rib lasagna and bread were tasty as well.

detailedReviews.author: Crystal Maynard
detailedReviews.text: We went on a Friday night, last minute. This was our first time going so didn't know what to expect. The first thing I noticed was the live entertainment. Nice music, not being played too loud. Small atmosphere but very nice a quaint. My boyfriend ordered the short rib rigatoni and it was really really good. Definitely will order again. I had the wood fired pizza, it was by far one of the best places I have ever been to eat. Will definitely go again.

detailedReviews.author: Heather T.
detailedReviews.text: We had a party of 8, the food, service, live music, and atmosphere were wonderful! Our server was very attentive. We had salads, pizzas, meatballs, calamari, and husband had the swordfish dinner special which was the best he has ever had.  Adorable place with a very welcoming vibe.  Great wine choices and the tiramisu was a perfect ending to our meal.

detailedReviews.author: Drew Johnson
detailedReviews.text: This little place was great and served very good pizza. My only complaint is that we were served a pizza and a steak knife to cut it. If we go back I will request them to cut our pizza for us as a steak knife was ready quite hard to use. We wound up barbarically ripping it apart. Which seems off in such a nice establishment. Still 5 stars just cut my pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Hakan Hatip
detailedReviews.text:
I like pizza and pasta here. Tiramisu also good. I will definitely go again.

You can park cross the street next to Leetrans I mean in the Walgreens.

detailedReviews.author: Tyson Norris
detailedReviews.text: Great food great people a must try a gem of Cape Coral best Italian restaurant in Lee county

detailedReviews.author: d m
detailedReviews.text: I'm a very picky person. I have nothing but, praise for this family restaurant. First time and not the last time. The food was wonderful and service was very good. Could not be more please with the place.

detailedReviews.author: Silvio Braun
detailedReviews.text: Absolut herzlich und sehr, sehr freundliche Inhaber. Alles sehr gut und zu 100% empfehlenswert. Weiter so

detailedReviews.author: Rob Murphy
detailedReviews.text: Been going to Ciao for many years, usually on special occasions. Second time with new owners and once again did not disappoint. Food was great. Service was top notch. We will be back

detailedReviews.author: George Rocha
detailedReviews.text: If I could award 10 stars I would. Not from anywhere around here, stumbled upon this place, just from a slight craving for Italian food. Atmosphere is quaint, home style, very welcoming. Our server Hudson, was very friendly, and well informed of the menu. From the beginning, the bread was so good that we decided some of it needed to come home with us. No exaggeration, the sauce, meatballs were perhaps the best that I have ever had. My girlfriend had chicken parm, and she said it was a definitive 10/10. I have zero idea why this hidden jewel, has a 4.5/5 rating, it should definitely be a 5/5. Do not take my word for it, you must try this place, to fully understand.

detailedReviews.author: Sue Couto
detailedReviews.text:
If you are in Cape Coral this is a MUST by far the best Italian food I have a had!
Hudson our server was amazing! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Katherine Conklin
detailedReviews.text: Second time here and had a fantastic dinner. Service was great and the atmosphere kind reminded me of an enoteca in Italy. The Bolognese Rigatoni was phenomenal as was the focaccia and meatball appetizer. The House Chianti was a generous pour and from a good winery. The only qualm we had with the meal was the short rib lasagna which was lacking about in quantity of the noodles and they were overdone. If there were a few more and they were al dente it would have been amazing as the flavor was great. Will be back again though.

detailedReviews.author: Elaine Rients
detailedReviews.text: Food and service was awesome. Will definitely go back.

detailedReviews.author: Judith vV
detailedReviews.text:
This is the first pizza place in Cape Coral that I have been to, that has any air in the pizza crust (!)- which is proper in my book. There are places in downtown Cape that take a rolling pin to their pizza dough... for real!
As it was my first visit, I ordered the Margerita, because in its simplicity there is nowhere to hide. We all noticed they use good mozarella, and while my friend enjoyed the marinara sauce, I prefer the pizza sauce just simply marzano tomato based. The dough was nice and chewy. Strangely enough the air was only in the outer part of the crust.
My arugula salad was ok, if uninspired with some very fibery bits of canned artichoke. The ceasar was much appeciated by my friends.
The wine list is very Costco, not the most interesting, but we found a nice bottle of red to share.
We liked the cozy look of the place and the singer, who had a beautiful voice and sang at a pleasant volume that made table conversation possible. The service was correct but we found it a bit lacking in warmth.
At a place like this one hopes for an offer of limoncello to conclude the meal, but only the check arrived.
I feel that with some tweaks this place could become a favorite.

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Kendall
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was great.  I've passed by this place for ages...it was my mistake not to stop in before last evening.   Don't make the same mistake... go there and enjoy.  I'll be back.

detailedReviews.author: Alexander Barrera
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza üçï

detailedReviews.author: Tony Marchese
detailedReviews.text: Always good

detailedReviews.author: Gennaro cerasoli
detailedReviews.text: We enjoyed our meals the service was very good.  My only complaint was we asked for espresso. They were out. No regular coffee either.  Won't go back. Wasn't able to finish a good meal

detailedReviews.author: Sandy Moore
detailedReviews.text: Lovely dinner and very comfortable!

detailedReviews.author: tony schall
detailedReviews.text: Great pizzas and wine!!  Stacey our server was awesome!!

detailedReviews.author: Jean Sauer
detailedReviews.text: Loved the pizza. Reminded me of Italy. Great experience

detailedReviews.author: John Pierson
detailedReviews.text: This place was great!  I had the pork chop dinner with fingerling potatoes and asparagus. Couldn‚Äôt have been better. The pork chop was huge, perfectly prepared with wonderful spiciness. The asparagus were very tender with is rare as I usually can‚Äôt stand restaurant rock hard asparagus. And the fingerling potatoes, a third hit.

detailedReviews.author: Arthur Olivari
detailedReviews.text:
Great traditional Italian restaurant.
Excellent service, Great food & reasonable priced.

detailedReviews.author: James Miller
detailedReviews.text: I had high hopes for this place and it did not disappoint! Considering what you can spend at a chain restaurant and leave a little unhappy with the food, I would say this is very well priced. They serve some great bread with complimentary caponata which was an amazing way to start the meal. Tried the Wild Mushroom Arancini which was amazing and the Gnocchi Primavera was so fluffy it was like eating marshmallows. The sauce was so rich full of flavor and the olives and artichoke added a nice balance with pops of flavor. Amazingly good!

detailedReviews.author: Ashlee Mae
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food. small cozy inviting dining room. The chef made each tables food one at a time. The arugula salad was the best salad I‚Äôve had in a long time. Everything was cooked to order. Primavera pizza was excellence in every bite. Bolognese Rigatoni was a good choice. Chicken parmigiana was top notch, perfectly seasoned and breaded. The quality of the food was worth the price especially compared to a chain like Olive Garden.

detailedReviews.author: Iessika Pino
detailedReviews.text: My family love this place!!! The food is amazing, Lindsey is great! Highly recommended!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Jack Brown
detailedReviews.text: Always a great experience.  I always take out of town guests here and never disappointed.

detailedReviews.author: life forreal
detailedReviews.text: Really enjoyed the Margherita pizza! Will definitely be going back to try more food!

detailedReviews.author: Erik Herman
detailedReviews.text: Food made to order, awesome bread awesome service!!!

detailedReviews.author: Savannah Melson
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great service. Family owned place, I can‚Äôt think of a single thing they could do better!

detailedReviews.author: Tina Kowalski
detailedReviews.text: The food was delicious. Our sever Hudson was great.  The appetizers were top notch.  Several of us had the triple tail fish special, great taste and presentation. Cr√®me br√ªl√©e and tiramisu were like a little Italian grandma made them for you. Highly recommend. Great family restaurant, will definitely be back.

detailedReviews.author: Linda Carpenter
detailedReviews.text: The food is wonderful...parking is a problem but well worth it. Please try this restaurant..you will be pleased.

detailedReviews.author: Nancy Ahrens
detailedReviews.text: Had a new great  Great waiter and very delicious meal. Perfect as always.

detailedReviews.author: Helen Steinberg
detailedReviews.text: Friday night date night! We shared Berries & Ricotta Salad, Burrata Capresse, and Primavera White Pizza. The salads were amazing. Berries and Ricotta could be dessert, it was so delicious. The Primavera pizza was perfectly cooked with tons of veggies and fresh mozzarella. Jose and Hudson teamed up to provide excellent service. Young lady who brought our bread and packed up the leftover pizza, made us feel welcome.

detailedReviews.author: Brett Allen
detailedReviews.text: Food is amazing and we like the smaller quieter atmosphere.  One of the best meatballs in town and definitely the best chicken parm I had down here.  We're originally from NJ, so its a treat when we find really good italian in Cape Coral.

detailedReviews.author: Aleem Gillani
detailedReviews.text: Parking lot is next door in someone else's space, so be careful about getting ticketed. The place is nice inside, very small and intimate, with a family restaurant feel. Service can be spotty, depending on who you get. The house wine wasn't great, a little harsh. Amongst all the apps and entrees we ordered, the single best dish was the Caesar salad. Fresh and crunchy with not too much dressing and pleasant citrus notes. Entrees were somewhat disappointing. Just ok, not incredibly flavorful. At one point we could smell very burnt pizza, perhaps when the cook forgot that he had one in the oven. Decent place, and nice to support the family owners, but none of us is desperate to return.

detailedReviews.author: Jerry
detailedReviews.text: This is a nice little spot.  The atmophere inside is very nice.  Our dinner was good but not as good as expected based on the price.  No lasagna on the menu, which from previous reviews, was rated high.  I would go back with out of towners but probably won't be a regular place for me.

detailedReviews.author: Nevelee Milliken
detailedReviews.text: We have past the place almost everyday on our walk.  I read them menu and said we have to try their pizza.  Well I was shocked  you can't get a pizza your way and the one we got was all burnt around the edges.  Our server was good she was very attentive but we will never go back.  Can't believe they would serve a pizza like this

detailedReviews.author: Michael OBrien (OB)
detailedReviews.text: The food was very good, service was right on point, and the atmosphere is very nice. We're able to talk the waiter was around when we needed him, we recommend this place highly

detailedReviews.author: Douglas Birnie
detailedReviews.text:
Picked up a wonderfully crisp wood fired pizza and two meatballs for a quick dinner!

Excellent quality - great crust - meatballs were flavorful and sauce was spot on!

Will be back

detailedReviews.author: Chris K
detailedReviews.text: Good wine, great food, great service, and fair prices. One of the Cape's better eateries and secrets. Go there.

detailedReviews.author: Aishia G
detailedReviews.text: The food was ok.  I ordered two pizzas, one wild mushroom and the other plain cheese. The mushroom was better. But when compared to Papa Joe just one street over, I would not return for pizza at Trattoria Ciao's.

detailedReviews.author: Francesca Lousia
detailedReviews.text: This restaurant is a hidden gem. Everything we ate was DELICIOUS. Food is fresh and authentic tasting. Service was also impeccable. You will not be disappointed!

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Mertz
detailedReviews.text: Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Pizza was awesome!

detailedReviews.author: lyn g braun
detailedReviews.text: Super cute place. Their red sauce was delicious! Great food,  excellent service!!

detailedReviews.author: Jaime L
detailedReviews.text:
The restaurant service is terrible.
Once you are sitted it will take awhile for someone to come over. After you put the food request in it will take 1 hour for the food to come out.  In the meantime, no one comes out to tell you that the food is on its way or taking long. The only reason you would know is if after 45 minutes you ask what is going on with the food order. No attempt is made to explain the situation.
The food itself is nothing special that would make it worth the wait or make you want to come back to the restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Della Fave
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic food/service and atmosphere. If you don‚Äôt go its your loss !!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Michael Benson
detailedReviews.text: This place came highly recommended.  That person must have been high on Crack. The menu we looked at online was big & spectacular but the menu at the restaurant was miniscule. Online I had seen 3 or 4 dishes that looked fantastic but none were available on new menu. The attitude of the server quickly changed from pleasant to ho-hum when we she eagerly told about the alcohol selection, which we were not interested in. The bread was stale like it had been sitting for a while. The portions were tiny for the price. (Avg $25-30) per plate.

detailedReviews.author: Anjie
detailedReviews.text: Always a great meal and service! We love Trattoria Ciao!!

detailedReviews.author: Tiffani Asher
detailedReviews.text: The service was outstanding. Everything that could go wrong for them this week has, but they served with smiles and courtesy. The ceiling ac vent was leaking, so they moved us promptly.  They had a rush the day before so they were out of a lot of items, but they sold us on the amazing dishes we did eat. I was impressed with the perseverance in spit of a situation they could not control.  We will return!

detailedReviews.author: David Rogers
detailedReviews.text: Puts the special in special occasions.  A valentine we will remember.

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Monko-DeBiasi
detailedReviews.text: This is a hidden Gem in the Cape!!  A must visit!!  Everything is fresh and made to order,  from pizzas to house speciality dishes... did I mention the homemade focaccia bread.  The Chef is very accommodating to special requests. And as a group of Italians that grew up on their  Mama's sauce ... every plate  was cleaned. lol.  You won't be disappointed!!!

detailedReviews.author: DL S
detailedReviews.text: The lasagna and gnocchi were ultra light and delicious! Very authentic! Hadn't been here in a while but will definitely be back sooner.

detailedReviews.author: Lorein Puckett
detailedReviews.text: There were 4 of us dining.  The lasagna was excellent.  Also the rigatoni with short rib sauce was out of this world!

detailedReviews.author: Stefan T
detailedReviews.text: Excellent food - we tried focaccia, EVOO, fried calamari, caprese salad, pizza margerita, pasta Alfredo with shrimp, cr√®me broulee. The tiramisu was more like a tiramisu cake rather than classic tiramisu, but it was also tasty. Great atmosphere (quiet live music) and service, and reasonable prices.  Minus 1/2 star for not having decaf espresso.

detailedReviews.author: Nicholas Abrams
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely love this place. It‚Äôs romantic enough for a nice date with the wife and also family friendly to bring the kids. Food is amazing (try the wild mushroom pizza) and their sauce is spot on. Service is outstanding as well. We have been a few times for dining in and just got pizza delivered last night. Every experience has exceeded my expectations.

detailedReviews.author: Melanie Harrison
detailedReviews.text: Granted we walked in without a reservation on a Friday night at 6.40pm. We were told it would be 7.15pm for a table for 2. We came back at 7.15, and now the same young lady told us it would be at least 8.00 before they can sit us. Why wouldn't you tell us from the beginning you couldn't accommodate another 2 person table? I would've gladly left and come back another time. Now, I would never come back, ever!

detailedReviews.author: Laura Aldana
detailedReviews.text: I was just denied service at this location after being told I had to wait 30 mins for a table. Meanwhile there were three tables available!! This is horrible service. Racists!

detailedReviews.author: V WATKINS
detailedReviews.text:
Food was excellent! Family ran even the young daughters are learning the business.
Quaint small seating inside, has extra outdoor weather permitting.

detailedReviews.author: jessica calvac
detailedReviews.text: Such a lovely time. Our server Hudson is so welcoming and kind!!

detailedReviews.author: Dragan Jichici
detailedReviews.text: Great food! Under new ownership. Love their pizza's one of the best in town!

detailedReviews.author: Sandra Scala
detailedReviews.text: Small restaurant service just OK food just OK portions are medium flavor good but slow to serve. Will NOT return. Pricey.

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Reed
detailedReviews.text: A nice little spot for some Italian. Good food. The pizza are closer to Italian style pizza. My buddy got gluten free. Don‚Äôt do that. Melissa was great.

detailedReviews.author: don annala
detailedReviews.text: Best date night restaurant in Florida!

detailedReviews.author: Kathleen Annala
detailedReviews.text: Our first visit to Trattoria Ciao this evening and we've already made a reservation for tomorrow evening. A wonderful, sweet, family-owned and run restaurant. Food and ambiance was intimate, elegant, and cozy. Our favorite type of ambiance. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Keith Finkelstein
detailedReviews.text: Phenomenal food, vibe, and service.

detailedReviews.author: Madge Middleton
detailedReviews.text:
lovely little  restaurant.
I had the lasagna, which was absolutely delicious, followed by creme brulee, also delicious.
we chose this restaurant because I viewed the menu on its website.
The menu in the restaurant is very different to the website menu and clearly needs updating.
having said that we had a great time

detailedReviews.author: Bella Logsdon
detailedReviews.text: Ordered the pizza Margherita and the Burrata Caprese Salad, both were amazing. The salad was very refreshing and the pizza was so delicious. Everything is affordable too! Will definitely become a regular spot, I'd highly recommend over a lot of nearby pizza spots.

detailedReviews.author: Anita Mohney
detailedReviews.text: Excellent service and delicious good! Love the small, quaint vibes. Definitely a repeat! The braised short rib Bolognese over rigatoni ohhhhhh

detailedReviews.author: jessica trippler
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is the BEST!

detailedReviews.author: Josethebanker
detailedReviews.text: In the beginning, it was hard to find a parking spot. You have to park at the front. I thought the restaurant had no one inside, and boy, I was wrong. It was a whole house inside the restaurant. It is a family-owned restaurant. The service was excellent, and the pizza was top-notch. Now, if you like New York pizza, be aware that the pizza here is from Napolitano, and don‚Äôt expect crispy pizza. I had the veal, and it was delicious. Not enough to take home, but enough to get a full stomach. I hope you enjoy it, just like I did!

detailedReviews.author: Richard McGahan
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôm h my goodness the short rib lasagna was amazing . What a gift for Cape Coral

detailedReviews.author: Michelle Abrams
detailedReviews.text: Excellent establishment , excellent food - especially the pizza and wonderful service !

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth
detailedReviews.text: So hard to find half way decent italian food anywhere in South Florida..  We'll folks look no further!! This place is deeeelicious!! üòã  From the focciaci bread.. the homemade burrata & fresh peaches & spicy chili honey to the coal oven mushroom & caramelized onions pizza! Don't get me started on the creme burlee.. everything was absolutely deeelicious.. so much so went 2x in row.. My Mom loves italian & loves a homemade sauce w a good meatball... She loved that too!! Owner/

detailedReviews.author: Danielle Shields
detailedReviews.text: Phenomenal! Such a great meal with quiet environment and lovely live music! We love the pizza, burrata caprese and bolognese and spaghetti and meatballs! Joel Gott wine was 10/10! Will be using uber eats on nights I don't want to drive but man this was exceptional

detailedReviews.author: Brandon Groenheide
detailedReviews.text: The best had the pizza and the lasagna it was spectacular love love love

detailedReviews.author: Theresa Hotwagner
detailedReviews.text:
We finally decided to give this place a try.
We were so impressed with the Neapolitan style, wood fired pizza. Literally brought back memories from our trip to Italy last year!
The Calabrian shrimp appetizer was deliciously seasoned with artichoke hearts and arugula.
House made tiramisu as dessert was unbelievable.
Everything was so seriously good, at such a reasonable price point.
Fernando was a terrific server.
You have to give it a try!  I might regret posting this, if I can‚Äôt get a table, but it deserves the shout out.

detailedReviews.author: mark marzonie
detailedReviews.text: So happy they have reopened under new management. Food is superb. Wood fired pizza is fab. Good wine selection and great service and atmosphere. Definitely going on our restaurant rotation

detailedReviews.author: Saulo Simoes
detailedReviews.text:
THEY SERVE NEAPOLITAN PIZZA NOW!!!
Under new management the chef Kieran makes a killer Neapolitan pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Trev Hunt
detailedReviews.text: My family comes from San Valentino Italy and this was beautiful food.

detailedReviews.author: Dominick DeNava
detailedReviews.text:
First time here, excellent food, excellent service from Fernando and a beautiful little restaurant.

Will be back again.

detailedReviews.author: Deborah Nelson
detailedReviews.text: Our first time at this restaurant and we will definitely be back. The food, service and entertainment were all fantastic. Nice wine list and angel hair pasta on the menu which is my favorite.

detailedReviews.author: Martha Martin
detailedReviews.text: Need more staff,seven tables too many for good service.MEATBALLS WERE FLAVORLESS,SHRIMP PICCATA SAME .NO SMELL OF GARLIC IN AN ITALIAN RESTAURANT. LEFT DISAPPOINTED.

detailedReviews.author: Todd Archer
detailedReviews.text: Dinner for 5 on Saturday.  Everything was excellent.  Each family member thoroughly enjoyed what they ordered.  The short rib lasagna was amazing.  The atmosphere is very intimate (and quiet).  I will book for just the wife and me.  The service was also all you could ask for.  The parking is a little tricky.  It's across the street, but not intuitive.  However, there's plenty of it.    Lastly, the prices were good.

detailedReviews.author: Joy Kidd
detailedReviews.text: Lovely Italian restaurant with tablecloths and linen napkins - my favorite way to dine.   Food and service was excellent.

detailedReviews.author: Karin Clare
detailedReviews.text: The owners are great and the food is very very good. Service is stellar and atmosphere is so inviting. I highly recommend Trattoria Ciao. It‚Äôs the Cape‚Äôs best kept secret!!!

detailedReviews.author: Neil Ryan
detailedReviews.text:
Just simple, authentic Italian food.
Great service. Very personable.
Wife had the lobster lasagna and I had the fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp. Getting hungry again just thinking about it. LOL

detailedReviews.author: From Me
detailedReviews.text: TOURIST TRAP! Big plates, small portions but they do have a big price! The staff was nice. They are smiling all the way to the bank. No justification for the overprices food. 6 ravioli? 12" pizza $18-$22, Really??? Don't waste your money. There are many other more reasonable options in town and up along Pine Island Road.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.6/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: The wood-fired pizza is consistently praised as one of the best, with its authentic taste taking customers back to Italy. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The atmosphere is described as quaint, cozy, and reminiscent of an enoteca in Italy, providing a welcoming and relaxing dining experience. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The service is frequently mentioned as attentive and friendly, with specific praise for servers like Hudson who enhance the dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and poor communication about table availability - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Menu discrepancies between online and in-restaurant offerings - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
Negative reviews about service quality and food inconsistencies - review management can address this concern

positive.author: Carmelo Lamotta
positive.text: First, I‚Äôm trying it. It was very delicious very relaxing cozy food was phenomenal and the smell from the Woodfire oven took me back to Sicily.

neutral.author: Judith vV
neutral.text:
This is the first pizza place in Cape Coral that I have been to, that has any air in the pizza crust (!)- which is proper in my book. There are places in downtown Cape that take a rolling pin to their pizza dough... for real!
As it was my first visit, I ordered the Margerita, because in its simplicity there is nowhere to hide. We all noticed they use good mozarella, and while my friend enjoyed the marinara sauce, I prefer the pizza sauce just simply marzano tomato based. The dough was nice and chewy. Strangely enough the air was only in the outer part of the crust.
My arugula salad was ok, if uninspired with some very fibery bits of canned artichoke. The ceasar was much appeciated by my friends.
The wine list is very Costco, not the most interesting, but we found a nice bottle of red to share.
We liked the cozy look of the place and the singer, who had a beautiful voice and sang at a pleasant volume that made table conversation possible. The service was correct but we found it a bit lacking in warmth.
At a place like this one hopes for an offer of limoncello to conclude the meal, but only the check arrived.
I feel that with some tweaks this place could become a favorite.

neutral.author: Aleem Gillani
neutral.text: Parking lot is next door in someone else's space, so be careful about getting ticketed. The place is nice inside, very small and intimate, with a family restaurant feel. Service can be spotty, depending on who you get. The house wine wasn't great, a little harsh. Amongst all the apps and entrees we ordered, the single best dish was the Caesar salad. Fresh and crunchy with not too much dressing and pleasant citrus notes. Entrees were somewhat disappointing. Just ok, not incredibly flavorful. At one point we could smell very burnt pizza, perhaps when the cook forgot that he had one in the oven. Decent place, and nice to support the family owners, but none of us is desperate to return.

negative.author: Nevelee Milliken
negative.text: We have past the place almost everyday on our walk.  I read them menu and said we have to try their pizza.  Well I was shocked  you can't get a pizza your way and the one we got was all burnt around the edges.  Our server was good she was very attentive but we will never go back.  Can't believe they would serve a pizza like this

negative.author: Aishia G
negative.text: The food was ok.  I ordered two pizzas, one wild mushroom and the other plain cheese. The mushroom was better. But when compared to Papa Joe just one street over, I would not return for pizza at Trattoria Ciao's.

negative.author: Jaime L
negative.text:
The restaurant service is terrible.
Once you are sitted it will take awhile for someone to come over. After you put the food request in it will take 1 hour for the food to come out.  In the meantime, no one comes out to tell you that the food is on its way or taking long. The only reason you would know is if after 45 minutes you ask what is going on with the food order. No attempt is made to explain the situation.
The food itself is nothing special that would make it worth the wait or make you want to come back to the restaurant.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
